title-group.article-title: FINITE ELEMENT METHODS FOR THE DISPLACEMENT OBSTACLE PROBLEM OF CLAMPED PLATES

abstract.p: We study finite element methods for the displacement obstacle problem of clamped Kirchhoff plates. A unified convergence analysis is provided for C 1 finite element methods, classical nonconforming finite element methods and C 0 interior penalty methods. Under the condition that the obstacles are sufficiently smooth and that they are separted from each other and the zero displacement boundary constraint, we prove that the convergence in the energy norm is O(h) for convex domains.
